showScoreExcerpt:
I do not believe that anybody’s mind was changed in the course of this show. Rather, the characters ultimately accepted and humanized each other. And that kind of safety, that kind of trust—that’s what has kept Jewish culture alive through thousands of years. The intergenerational trauma of the Holocaust was incredibly well expressed, as were the differences in how each generation copes with this trauma and expresses their own beliefs. The juxtapositions of coping methods were truly brilliant.
